channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Consumers are crypto-curious — One in five own digital currency: Accenture
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: An end-of-the-year report from Accenture showed that despite traditional payment methods dominating many markets, consumers are curious about crypto.

item.title: Alaska adds 'virtual currency' to its regulatory regime
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Starting in 2023, the companies will have to obtain a new type of license to operate with crypto in the state.

item.title: Crypto on-chain crime drama sees the good guys finally win
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Security firm Harpie managed to avert a crypto robbery by simply paying a higher gas fee than the exploiter.

item.title: Superhero cans merger with Swyftx, citing regulatory scrutiny
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Australian investing platform Superhero assured users that their funds are safe and that neither their personal data nor assets were provided to crypto exchange Swyftx.

item.title: Bitcoin miner Core Scientific reportedly filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Core Scientific is reportedly filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Texas due to falling revenue and BTC prices.

item.title: Current infrastructure can't support the metaverse, says Huawei report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The chief strategist for Huawei's Middle East region says networks have issues with throughput, rendering and download speeds that need resolving.

item.title: How to avoid getting hooked by crypto ‘ice phishing’ scammers — CertiK
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Ice phishing is a type of scam that exists only in Web3 and is a “considerable threat” to the crypto community, the firm says.

item.title: What blockchain analysis can and can't do to find FTX's missing funds: Blockchain.com CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Peter Smith says the hardest thing to trace is the funds that enter the banking system.

item.title: Nifty News: Trump’s NFTs tank, NBA star’s collection gone in 77 seconds and more...
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: NFT gaming is at a similar stage to the early mobile gaming days, says a Magic Eden exec, while an analyst from Dune Analytics claims that 58% of NFT trading volume this year has been wash trades.

item.title: Celsius amasses 30 potential bidders for its assets, withdrawal motion approved
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: The bankrupt lender is set to hold auctions for its assets in January, while it's been given the green light to return some customer funds.

item.title: SBF signs extradition papers, set to return to face charges in the US
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The FTX founder has reportedly signed on the dotted line, bringing him a step closer to returning to US soil.

item.title: Who has returned donations or contributions from FTX amid the firm’s reputational risks?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Politicians and news organizations have reportedly planned to return roughly $6.6 million in donations from FTX — a mere fraction of the crypto exchange's estimated contributions.

item.title: Uniswap to allow users to buy cryptocurrency using debit and credit cards
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: Users of the decentralized exchange will also be able to use bank transfers to purchase crypto.

item.title: 4 legislative predictions for crypto in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By J.W. Verret
item.description: We may not see much from Congress, but there is a chance the SEC will continue making crypto policy via litigation.

item.title: Ethereum bounces above $1.2K, but derivatives metrics show traders fear a collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Demand for leverage buying remains absent in ETH despite the recent bounce to $1,200 as the U.S. Federal Reserve continues to hike interest rates.

item.title: Binance joins lobbying group as criticism of the exchange ramps up
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The exchange has come under increasing pressure from critics after the collapse of its rival, FTX.

item.title: Auros Global expects to resume regular operations following restructuring plan
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The crypto trading firm reportedly suffered from a $20 million dollar exposure in the FTX collapse.

item.title: Blockchain VC funding surpasses 2021 total despite declining since May
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph Research
item.description: After a tumultuous year in crypto, investors are now more selective with their funding.

item.title: Former Diablo Immortal devs pick ImmutableX for upcoming Web3 MMORPG
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Metaverse Game Studios announces partnership with blockchain gaming platform ImmutableX to power upcoming Web3 gaming title Angelic.

item.title: Bitcoin miner Greenidge signs $74M debt restructuring agreement with NYDIG
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The deal, if executed, would essentially restructure the company into a hosting firm for Bitcoin mining rigs.

item.title: What it’s actually like to use Bitcoin in El Salvador
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall

item.title: ‘Forget a pivot’ — Markets won’t see Fed rate cut boost in 2023, says analyst
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin, stocks or else, there is now no light at the end of the Fed rate hike tunnel in 2023, says Jim Bianco.

item.title: Waves founder announces new stablecoin as USDN depegs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Days after USDN lost its peg with USD, Waves CEO and founder Sasha Ivanov promised that his new stablecoin will be “undepeggable."

item.title: 3 reasons why BNB price risks another 30% decline by January
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: BNB has entered the breakdown stage of its prevailing ascending triangle pattern alongside some negative fundamentals that can push price further down.

item.title: Game developers expect to work on Web3 games in the future: Survey
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: A new survey shows that developers believe integrating Web3 will have an impact on user acquisition and retention.

item.title: Cointelegraph’s crypto intelligence platform is turning 2
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: Research suggests that historical analysis of crypto markets, combined with real-time conditions and investor sentiment, can be extremely informative.

item.title: Sango Coin listing postponed by Central African Republic
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall
item.description: As the first country to adopt Bitcoin as legal tender in Africa, the Central African Republic appears to be struggling with its investor-oriented token, Sango Coin.

item.title: Animoca Brands is the most funded metaverse developer in 2022: Nasdaq
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: New data from Nasdaq research revealed that over the last investors were keener to back late-stage industry leaders such as Animoca Brands compared to early-stage startups.

item.title: South Korean court freezes $92M in assets related to Terra tokens
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The CEO of Terraform Labs’ affiliate firm Kernel Labs reportedly held the largest amount in illegal proceeds from Terra.

item.title: Projects would rather get hacked than pay bounties, Web3 developer claims
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: After reporting and helping patch a smart contract vulnerability, the developer claims that the projects he helped started to ignore him.
